books.title: Speculative Everything: Design, Fiction, and Social Dreaming
books.author: Anthony Dunne and Fiona Raby
books.reference: Dunne, Anthony, and Fiona Raby. *Speculative Everything: Design, Fiction, and Social Dreaming*. MIT Press, 2013.
books.description: A foundational text in speculative design that explores how designers can create provocative, imaginative scenarios to challenge assumptions and rethink possible futures. This book shaped the conceptual foundation of this project—particularly in using fiction and thought experiments to engage with ecological themes and alternative realities.

books.title: Interspecies Communication and Performance
books.author: Joanna Page
books.reference: Page, Joanna. “Interspecies communication and performance.” Decolonizing Science in Latin American Art, UCL Press, 2021.
books.description: Introduced ideas of using technology as a channel for non-human expression. Vital to shaping the performative aspects of A Friendly Hand.

books.title: Program Earth
books.author: Jennifer Gabrys
books.description: Explores environmental sensing technologies and how they shape our understanding of Earth. Inspired me to reframe sensing as a shared, speculative act.

books.title: See Yourself Sensing: Redefining Human Perception
books.author: Madeline Schwartzman
books.reference: Schwartzman, Madeline. See Yourself Sensing: Redefining Human Perception. 2011.
books.description: An illustrated archive of sensory prosthetics and art experiments. Helped ground the aesthetic and conceptual foundation of the sensing machine.

articles.title: Reviewing the Relationship between Neoliberal Societies and Nature
articles.author: Jeanne M. Bogert et al.
articles.reference: Bogert, Jeanne M., et al. “Reviewing the Relationship between Neoliberal Societies and Nature.” Ecology and Society, vol. 27, no. 2, 2022, p. art7.
articles.description: Analyzes how dominant social paradigms in neoliberal societies contribute to ecological unsustainability. Helpful in understanding broader systems at play.

articles.title: Ethics, Ecology, and the Future: Art and Design Face the Anthropocene
articles.author: Kayla Anderson
articles.reference: Anderson, Kayla. “Ethics, Ecology, and the Future: Art and Design Face the Anthropocene.” Leonardo, vol. 48, no. 4, Aug. 2015, pp. 338–47.
articles.description: Explores how art and design intersect with ethical and ecological concerns in the Anthropocene. Key in shaping how I situate speculative work in real-world crises.

articles.title: Extinction of Experience: The Loss of Human–Nature Interactions
articles.author: Masashi Soga and Kevin J. Gaston
articles.reference: Soga, Masashi, and Kevin J. Gaston. “Extinction of Experience.” Frontiers in Ecology and the Environment, vol. 14, no. 2, Mar. 2016, pp. 94–101.
articles.description: Explains how loss of direct contact with nature weakens care and awareness. Reinforced the need for creating sensory interventions.

casestudies.title: Trees Talk to Each Other. 'Mother Tree' Ecologist Hears Lessons for People, Too
casestudies.author: Dave Davies (NPR interview with Suzanne Simard)
casestudies.reference: Davies, Dave. “Trees Talk to Each Other. 'Mother Tree' Ecologist Hears Lessons for People, Too.” NPR, 4 May 2021.
casestudies.description: An accessible introduction to Suzanne Simard’s research on mycorrhizal networks, framing it through storytelling. Helpful in grounding the emotional tone of the project and framing scientific ideas for a general audience.
